Monte Carlo simulation program specializing in tracking particles in electric and magnetic fields

2 // Created by trost on 27.05.15.

4 #include "KSInteractionsMessage.h"
5 #include "KConst.h"
6 #include "KSIntDecayCalculatorFerencBBRTransition.h"
7 #include "KRandom.h"
8 using katrin::KRandom;
9 using katrin::KConst;
10 
11 namespace Kassiopeia
12 {
13 
14  KSIntDecayCalculatorFerencBBRTransition::KSIntDecayCalculatorFerencBBRTransition() :
15  fTargetPID( 0 ),
16  fminPID( 0 ),
17  fmaxPID( 0 ),
18  fLastn( -1 ),
19  fLastl( -1 ),
20  fLastLifetime( std::numeric_limits<double>::max() )
21  {
22  fCalculator = new RydbergCalculator();
23  }
24 
25  KSIntDecayCalculatorFerencBBRTransition::KSIntDecayCalculatorFerencBBRTransition( const KSIntDecayCalculatorFerencBBRTransition& aCopy ) :
26  KSComponent(),
27  fTargetPID( aCopy.fTargetPID ),
28  fminPID( aCopy.fminPID ),
29  fmaxPID( aCopy.fmaxPID ),
30  fLastn( aCopy.fLastn ),
31  fLastl( aCopy.fLastl ),
32  fLastLifetime( aCopy.fLastLifetime )
33  {
34  fCalculator = new RydbergCalculator();
35  for(int n = 0; n <=150; n++)
36  {
37  for( int l = 0; l < n; l++)
38  {
39  low_n_lifetimes[n][l] = aCopy.low_n_lifetimes[n][l];
40  }
41  }
42  }
43 
44 
45  void KSIntDecayCalculatorFerencBBRTransition::InitializeComponent() {
46 
47  for(int n = 0; n <150; n++)
48  {
49  for( int l = 0; l < n+1; l++)
50  {
51  int npmax = 10 * (n+1);
52  if ((n+1) > 80)
53  npmax = 5 * (n+1);
54 
55  low_n_lifetimes[n][l] = 1./(fCalculator->PBBRdecay(fTemperature,n+1,l)
56  +fCalculator->PBBRexcitation(fTemperature,n+1,l,npmax));
57  }
58  }
59  }
60 
61  KSIntDecayCalculatorFerencBBRTransition* KSIntDecayCalculatorFerencBBRTransition::Clone() const
62  {
63  return new KSIntDecayCalculatorFerencBBRTransition( *this );
64  }
65 
66  KSIntDecayCalculatorFerencBBRTransition::~KSIntDecayCalculatorFerencBBRTransition()
67  {
68  delete fCalculator;
69  }
70 
71  void KSIntDecayCalculatorFerencBBRTransition::CalculateLifeTime( const KSParticle& aParticle,
72  double& aLifeTime )
73  {
74  long long tPID = aParticle.GetPID();
75  if ( (tPID == fTargetPID && fTargetPID != 0) || ( (tPID >= fminPID) && ( tPID <= fmaxPID)) )
76  {
77  int n = aParticle.GetMainQuantumNumber();
78  int l = aParticle.GetSecondQuantumNumber();
79 
80  if((n == fLastn) && ( l == fLastl )) {
81  aLifeTime = fLastLifetime;
82  return;
83  }
84 
85  if( n <= 150 ){
86  fLastLifetime = low_n_lifetimes[n-1][l];
87  aLifeTime = fLastLifetime;
88  fLastn = n;
89  fLastl = l;
90  return;
91  }
92 
93 
94  int npmax = 10 * n;
95  if (n > 80)
96  npmax = 5 * n;
97 
98  if (npmax > 8000)
99  npmax = 8000;
100 
101  fLastLifetime = 1./(fCalculator->PBBRdecay(fTemperature,n,l)
102  +fCalculator->PBBRexcitation(fTemperature,n,l,npmax));
103  fLastn = n;
104  fLastl = l;
105 
106  aLifeTime = fLastLifetime;
107  } else
108  {
109  aLifeTime = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
110  }
111  return;
112  }
113 
114  void KSIntDecayCalculatorFerencBBRTransition::ExecuteInteraction( const KSParticle& anInitialParticle,
115  KSParticle& aFinalParticle,
116  KSParticleQueue& /*aSecondaries*/)
117  {
118  aFinalParticle.SetTime( anInitialParticle.GetTime() );
119  aFinalParticle.SetPosition( anInitialParticle.GetPosition() );
120  aFinalParticle.SetMomentum( anInitialParticle.GetMomentum() );
121 
122  if ( (anInitialParticle.GetPID() == fTargetPID && fTargetPID != 0) || ( (anInitialParticle.GetPID() >= fminPID) && ( anInitialParticle.GetPID() <= fmaxPID)) )
123  {
124  int n = anInitialParticle.GetMainQuantumNumber();
125  int l = anInitialParticle.GetSecondQuantumNumber();
126  int np = n;
127  int lp = l;
128  double tRate;
129 
130  fCalculator->BBRTransitionGenerator(fTemperature, n, l, tRate, np, lp);
131 
132  aFinalParticle.SetMainQuantumNumber(np);
133  aFinalParticle.SetSecondQuantumNumber(lp);
134 
135  if(np == 1)
136  {
137  aFinalParticle.SetActive(false);
138  aFinalParticle.SetLabel( GetName() );
139  }
140 
141  fStepNDecays = 1;
142  fStepEnergyLoss = 0.;
143 
144  }
145 
146  return;
147  }
148 
149 }
